---
title: "Community guidelines"
---

## Reporting issues and bugs

In case you encounter issues or bugs, please report them via
[GitHub issues](https://github.com/retostauffer/python-colorspace/issues).
Before creating a new issue, please check for _existing issues_.
If the problem has already be reported, you are more than welcome to
_add a comment_ to report when/where you encountered the same problem.

When opening (or commenting on) an issue it helps us a lot if you can
include a minimal example to reproduce the problem (if possible) as well
as the error thrown.

## Contribute

You are welcome to contribute to Python _colorspace_ via
[GitHub](https://github.com/retostauffer/python-colorspace) as follows:

* **Create a fork:** Start by forking the [repository](https://github.com/retostauffer/python-colorspace).
* **Create new branch:** Create a new branch for your feature request or bug fix.
    Please make changes against the current `main` branch.
* **Make changes:** Make the required changes and push them to GitHub.
* **Create pull request:** Create pull request.

Handling of pull requests:

* **Reviewing:** Your pull request will be reviewed by the maintainers
    of the repository. If needed they may ask questions, suggest changes,
    or reject the pull request if not suitable.
* **Make changes:** If changes are requested by the maintainers, please
    implement them and update your pull request accordingly.
* **Merge:** If approved, your changes will be merged into the main branch.
    Congrats and thank you for your contribution!

## Support

The first point of contact is our this documentation where you find a lot
of examples on how to use the software. In case the documentation does not
answer your question, feel free to reach out to us via the
[GitHub issues](https://github.com/retostauffer/python-colorspace/issues).
